title: Phrack Inc. Newsletter 25th Issue Anniversary Index
historical_context: This article serves as a retrospective of the Phrack zine, celebrating its 25th issue and summarizing the evolution of hacking and phreaking culture during the late 1980s.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in the history of hacker culture.
short_summary: The article provides an index of all articles published in Phrack from its inception in 1985 to its 25th issue in 1989, highlighting key topics and contributors that shaped the early hacker community.
summary:
In this comprehensive index, Knight Lightning and Taran King reflect on the journey of Phrack Inc. from its first issue in November 1985 to its 25th issue in March 1989. The article lists all the articles published in each issue, categorizing them by topic and author, which serves as a valuable resource for anyone interested in the evolution of hacking and phreaking. The index not only showcases the diversity of content, ranging from technical guides to philosophical musings, but also highlights the collaborative spirit of the hacker community during this formative period.

The retrospective emphasizes the significance of Phrack as a platform for knowledge sharing and community building among hackers. It captures the essence of the era, where information was shared freely, and the lines between hacking and phreaking were often blurred. This article is a must-read for those looking to understand the roots of hacker culture and the foundational texts that continue to influence the field today.
